meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel sudden shock or alarm.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise did startle the cat.
meanings.sent2: I startle easily at unexpected sounds.
meanings.sent3: The startle from the prank made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sudden clap of thunder startled the sleeping baby awake.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected appearance of the ghost was enough to startle anyone.

meanings.sent2: I startle when someone sneaks up behind me.
meanings.sent3: His startle at the magician's trick was priceless.
meanings.sent4: The news of the unexpected win startled the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The sudden burst of confetti startled the birthday girl in a delightful way.
